website_summaries.verdict: Though a tad pricier than we would have liked, the Optoma MovieTime DV10 does a good job delivering an all-in-one home-theater experience.
pros: All-in-one home theater with built-in DVD player and speakers
cons: Setting it up on a coffee table isn't as easy as it should be
dual menu system takes some getting used to

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: The built in DVD player and speakers are good and very practical, which makes it a good unit overall. The problems are: 1) The resolution could be a little better. This 800x600 doesn't match my needs anymore. 2) It doesn't come with a VGA cable. Shame on you, Optoma! 3) Optoma tech support does not answer my e-mails. Shame on you, Optoma! 4) The zoom function is almost useless. So you need to move the unit back and forward to adjust the image size. The zoom function is used to minimal adjustments only. 5) The DVD player is not region free. [UPDATE] 6) After 18 months the speakers are gone...
customer_reviews.author: Murilo Ribeiro

customer_reviews.title: They opened the box
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a new unit. Got a called today to say they had to open the box to make sure it was alright. If it is brand new they should of not had to open it. Now what proof do I have it is brand new. They could switch the item.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Teaching classes with DVDs
customer_reviews.text: My father teaches a course on weekends and he needed the right package to show dvds to his students while being portable. This was the solution. Its great because theres only one power cord to plug in to get it to work. Everything needed to get started right off the bat is basically in one package. Had my dad bought it all separately he would've bought 1 dvd player 1 projector and a pair of speakers all of which have to be plugged into a surge outlet and all the wires connecting them all together.. it would've been hell. Instead he has this nice all in one which effectively puts it all together. A very good buy for this case.
customer_reviews.author: SparX

customer_reviews.title: Very good picture quaity/DVD player sucks
customer_reviews.text: The projector has very good picture quality. It doesn't seam to have digital video input but I have used it both through the analog VGA and the DVD and the picture quality is very good. The DVD player seams to be deprived from some functionality (i.e. cannot fast forward or rewind, it only jumps between chapters) but of course this could be me not being able to figure out the buttons :)
customer_reviews.author: Ghost

customer_reviews.title: New and Improved
customer_reviews.text: i chose 4 stars, because instead of the 'hatch' [ DV10 model ] this unit has the 'disc slot.' Most other features are the same from its brother [ DV10 ]. If you present materials in Mirosoft Power Point. This is for you AND if you want to have 'Movie' night @ your place. Great unit for such a cause. Not....HD however, it is still worth the $$$
customer_reviews.author: Ds_esnce

customer_reviews.title: Loved it! my old projector quit on me the ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved it! my old projector quit on me the day it arrived, it is so much nicer than my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY UNRELIABLE don't buy, you will regret it
customer_reviews.text: The unit is very finicky. It plays OK the DVDs, but has hard time detecting the connection to the computer. It breaks down, I had to send for replacement 2 times. Now it is out of warranty and it broke down again. The want me to pay $110 just to look at it. They charge $100/hour for their labor and parts are not cheap (e.g. lamp cost over $300). My recommendation: Stay away from Optoma. I think a big screen TV / monitor, is much better. You don't need screen, you can watch it with ambient light, much more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Veet Vivarto

customer_reviews.title: Best portable unit on the market
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to use. Very portable and not bulky. Great remote included. Great picture. Cons: Speakers are not loud enough so we had to make sure and buy external speakers and an amp to get the sound better for us.
customer_reviews.author: Alexx LeVasseur

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular!
customer_reviews.text: I did lots and lots of research of projectors before decided to buy this one and I could not be more pleased. I set this up in my room and projected it on a white wall and it looks amazing. Do not waste your money buying a $2000 flatscreen TV when this projector is at such a cheap price. The speakers on this are decent but if you're looking for surround sound then you deffinately need to buy speakers. The overall picture is amazing, you will not be disappointed with this projector!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Great and Reliable Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this projector about three years ago and I got it shipped to me while in Iraq, we watched movies on it constantly and took it with me to a couple of places. I now have it currently with me in Afghanistan and the projector still works like it first did straight out of the box. Obviously some scratches here and there, and i haven't had to replace the lamp once yet. Being my first projector i think it was a great buy and i couldn't ask for anything better.
customer_reviews.author: nbkiller187

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Big screen shows
customer_reviews.text: We use this machine alot! Love it! Big screen shows!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie M. Bury

customer_reviews.title: This unit was described as being in good condition and working order
customer_reviews.text: This unit was described as being in good condition and working order. However, one of the two speakers does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Aldon Kuiper

customer_reviews.title: Disposable Machine!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine...there is just one problem. It is disposable!!!! We bought one and before long the discs would not load right away. Then some of the discs would not load at all. Then it would shut down after an hour and so forth until we sent it back and got another. The same thing happened to the second...and the third!!!! Don't waste your time with this one. The Epson Movie Mate 72 is superior.
customer_reviews.author: Mary in the Morning

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME !!!
customer_reviews.text: It's worth having for the $550 tag with a free 72" projector screen, I bought during the Thanksgiving sale. I also threw in a 7.1 Onkyo Home Theater which I also bought during the thanksgiving for $400, and the result is unmatchable. The sound, the picture, it feels like never getting out of the basement. Do buy it if you get it for the same price I paid or even less.
customer_reviews.author: Avinash Vyas

customer_reviews.title: Just D best!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have my projector for 15 years now, this is the best purchase ever, thanks for Optoma This is just a wonderful product, I hope one day they make it again, I will be the first one to purchase. ******
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DVD Player Died
customer_reviews.text: I'd agree with most of the positive comments previously posted about this unit regarding image quality and convenience of use. Can't say I had any "smell" issues. Overall, the unit is very impressive. The problem I encountered is that the DVD player died after about twelve hours of use. Disappointing. Seller took it back without a whimper and I was impressed enough to get a replacement unit rather than a refund. We'll see how the new unit holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Maui Boy

customer_reviews.title: Bring your own candy & popcorn
customer_reviews.text: Have previous version, gave this unit to my sister's family (2 girls - 12 & 14). Brother-in-law, sister & family love theirs. Use it for movie nights while floating in their pool (patching the sound through pool speakers). Picture big and clear while placed safely away from water. Have used mine in backyard, living room, and for presentations to groups where previously used multiple video screens. Easy to use, more than enough inputs, remote control. While screen gives best picture, it does alright on a wall or sheet. Only problem, it doesn't make popcorn!
customer_reviews.author: Bay Kid

customer_reviews.title: Surprising, in a good way
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect this projector to look this good for the price and features. But coupled with the Da-Lite 106-inch screen, this looks fantastic. Also, the fact that it has built-in speakers is not typical for this sort of projector. They are plenty loud for a mid-sized room. I'm just surprised how great this looks. And it's so easy to operate. No regrets here on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Denise A. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Just great - nothing less than 5
customer_reviews.text: This projector is awesome. I was truly amazed at the quality of the picture. You really get a feeling of watching a movie in the theater. Just awesome. The remote could be better - takes a while to get used to it. Just Buy it. Btw, this is my first projector - so can't compare with anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon UserOne

customer_reviews.title: for the price come on
customer_reviews.text: Bought the item for the kids new years. The purchase was made without even seeing the quality of image and going on reviews. I went to a store that had projectors that were on display. The images were great and the prices ranged from 3000 to 10000. This machine comes pretty close and the price,come on. This is a great entry level machine. With an extended warranty you are laughing and you are now your own movie house. I have not noticed any smell and the image looks great even on a bed sheet. Just thought about summer time movies at night at the cottage under the stars.
customer_reviews.author: serpico toronto

customer_reviews.title: NICE PROJECTOR - RIPPED ON PRICE
customer_reviews.text: The picture this projector makes is very good, it does suffer slightly from the rainbow effect common with single chip DLP projectors. I wish the sound would play a little louder. When I bought this projector it was priced at $1499.00, two weeks after I got it the price dropped to $1299.00. I thought well ok I guess I can live with that - prices do drop on electronic equipment all the time. Now the price is $999.00, come on OPTOMA, you really stuck it to early adopters. I'd recommend this projector to anyone once the price drops to $699.00, should be in the next several weeks.
customer_reviews.author: K. J. Searcy

customer_reviews.title: Still lovin' it after 18 months
customer_reviews.text: We've had the Movietime for over a year and still love it. The convenience is great. We don't have a seperate AV room and we don't want to set up a bunch of audio video gear in our living room, so when we want to watch videos we just plop down the Optoma and point it a the wall. Huge image, excellent color and sharpness. The sound is adequate. For us it's the perfect solution and well worth the dough.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect value for money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Optoma DV10 from Circuit city back in May 2007 that came along with free 92-inch screen and subwoofer. Without a doubt I will recommend this product to anyone who knows how to enjoy advanced technology and this one is the perfect one. With the attached subwoofer and 92 inch screen by default it make my home feel at movie theater and quality and clarity of picture is great. My 5 stars to this product. Now all I have to do is buy a spare lamp for future purposes, THE END!!
customer_reviews.author: Arvind Kappula

customer_reviews.title: 1st time buyer - best purchase I have made this year
customer_reviews.text: We are very excited about this projector. right off the box ! anyone looking into hd tv's should consider this - the image is as big as we could ever want it to be - and with an HD TV feed - picture is crazy !
customer_reviews.author: S. N.

customer_reviews.title: me too -  3 years and still pefect
customer_reviews.text: we've been using it for 3 years now and love it - people are amazed at the quality despite the fact that it isn't HD...
customer_reviews.author: honest reviewer guy

customer_reviews.title: A movie theatre in my living room
customer_reviews.text: I love this projector!!! It's easy to use, portable, beautiful picture. It's giving my family hours of pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Ridge

customer_reviews.title: Good projector/DVD player
customer_reviews.text: This is a fairly good projector and it has a nice sound system. Obviously, it is not comparable to a full blown surround sound system but it holds pretty well given its' size. Picture quality is very good as well and the ease of use is top notch. Must improve on its' design and the weight of this machine. Overall, 4 1/2 stars out of 5 and I have seen my fair share of projectors.
customer_reviews.author: Raynard Cayetano

customer_reviews.title: Optoma DV 11 A Great Product
customer_reviews.text: We love our Optoma DV 11. It is simple to use and has a great picture. We use it outside on a 16'by 9'screen it makes a cool backyard theater. The speakers are more than adequate for inside but for the outside we added an 80 watt surround sound system. Why pay big money for the flat screen TV's when you can have a HUGE screen.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight D. Shoup

customer_reviews.title: Life Changing
customer_reviews.text: I'm one of the Black Friday owners - and I have to say, this was hands down the best $450 ever spent. I haven't gotten the screen yet, but it looks great even projected against my GREEN living room walls. Go figure.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Optoma DVD Projector for my husband for Christmas, and we are thrilled with the product! We literally opened up the package, plugged it in, and were watching a DVD in just a couple of minutes. The picture quality is amazing, the built in speakers emit great sound, and it is compact and easy to transport, unbelievable. It absolutely lives up to my expectations, and I would recommend it completely. Fantastic!!!
customer_reviews.author: Moira Ann Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Terrific!
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific projector - great brightness, throw size and so simple to use. The sound is great as is, however, I am going to match it with a couple of speakers and an inexpensive 5.1 receiver for those times where some punch is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Todd A

customer_reviews.title: Three years on and still loving our Optoma
customer_reviews.text: We've had one of these now for three years. We use it several times a week to watch DVDs and streaming video (via laptop) projected on a blank wall in our living room. We LOVE it.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Donovan

customer_reviews.title: My First Projector
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2006 and still using it. Best movie projector combo that I have seen so far. It has DVD Player and Speaker too...All in One. Optoma Rocks... Asawari C
customer_reviews.author: Asawari Chingale

customer_reviews.title: Mac recognition problem
customer_reviews.text: I'm generally very happy with this product. There is one problem: when I tried to connect the projector to my Mac Powerbook, it did not recognize it. Optoma Tech Support has confirmed this, said they're working on a solution, and will send me a replacement when they solve it.
customer_reviews.author: W. I. Van Campen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to purchasing and owning the product, but after I completed the transaction I was told it was not available. The only comment I received was "The product is no longer available." I have one question: why sell something if it's "not available"? I was very disappointed indeed!
customer_reviews.author: Freedom

product_meta.title: Optoma DV10 MovieTime Home Theater DLP Projector With Built-In DVD Player
product_meta.description:
Style:dv10FROM THE MANUFACTURER
MovieTime is a revolutionary digital projector with a fully-integrated DVD player and speakers. Turns any space into a home theater instantly! Just plug in, point it at the wall and presto! Perfectly designed for a wide range of home entertainment applications, from viewing the latest blockbuster, playing games, or watching home movies with friends and family. 

 Features

 

 * Direct digital signal from DVD player to screen for rich cinema experience 
 * HDTV compatibility for high-definition entertainment from a variety of sources 
 * Optimized settings provide true widescreen cinema-quality performance 
 * Optical audio output ideal for Dolby Surround sound experience 

 The MovieTime home theater includes: 

 * A projector with lens cap 
 * Composite video cable 1.8 meters 
 * Power cord 1.8 meters 
 * D-Sub to RCA adapter 
 * Carrying case 
 * IR remote control 
 *  2 AA batteries 
 * User manual 
 * ProShow Gold slide show and presentation creator software (demo version)
feature_bullets: 36 - 335 Image size projected on wall or screen (for best resolution, contrast, and brightness, we suggest purchasing an optional screen)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars95 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
